title: 'The big project': The secret strategy behind Hamas' surprise attack on Israel on Oct 7
content: Hamas leaders, including Yahya Sinwar, spent over two years planning an attack on Israel, revealed in documents obtained by The New York Times. They sought involvement from Iran and Hezbollah. The attack, initially planned for 2022, aimed to disrupt Israel's normalisation with Saudi Arabia and assert control over regional disputes.
summary: Hamas leaders, including Yahya Sinwar, spent over two years planning an attack on Israel, revealed in documents obtained by The New York Times. They sought involvement from Iran and Hezbollah. The attack, initially planned for 2022, aimed to disrupt Israel's normalisation with Saudi Arabia and assert control over regional disputes.

title: Why King Charles has not disclosed the list of gifts Royal Family received since 2020
content: ​Anti-monarchy campaign group Republic has hit out at the Royal Family and said if politicians are expected to display higher standards by mandatory disclosure of gifts, the same should be demanded from the royals as well. Graham Smith, chief executive of Republic, said: “If politicians are being lambasted for failing to declare gifts, the same should apply to the royals.
summary: ​Anti-monarchy campaign group Republic has hit out at the Royal Family and said if politicians are expected to display higher standards by mandatory disclosure of gifts, the same should be demanded from the royals as well. Graham Smith, chief executive of Republic, said: “If politicians are being lambasted for failing to declare gifts, the same should apply to the royals.

title: Video: Murder suspects disguise as energy workers before killing jewelry store owner
content: Authorities in Detroit have released doorbell footage showing two suspects posing as energy workers, before allegedly killing 72-year-old jewelry store owner Hussein Murray in his home. The suspects, wearing high-visibility vests and face masks, are being sought, with one already apprehended in Louisiana.
summary: Authorities in Detroit have released doorbell footage showing two suspects posing as energy workers, before allegedly killing 72-year-old jewelry store owner Hussein Murray in his home. The suspects, wearing high-visibility vests and face masks, are being sought, with one already apprehended in Louisiana.

title: Iran reduces sentence of jailed journalists after clearing them of collaborating with US
content: An Iranian court cleared Niloofar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi of collaborating with the US, reducing their prison sentences to five years. They were originally jailed for reporting on the death of Mahsa Amini, which led to major protests in Iran in 2022 and 2023.
summary: An Iranian court cleared Niloofar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi of collaborating with the US, reducing their prison sentences to five years. They were originally jailed for reporting on the death of Mahsa Amini, which led to major protests in Iran in 2022 and 2023.

title: Sudan rescuers say air strike killed 23 in Khartoum market
content: A Sudanese volunteer network reported that an airstrike by the military struck a marketplace near the paramilitary RSF's main camp in Khartoum, resulting in 23 fatalities and over 40 injuries. The attack on Saturday afternoon is part of ongoing civil conflict that has claimed thousands of lives.
summary: A Sudanese volunteer network reported that an airstrike by the military struck a marketplace near the paramilitary RSF's main camp in Khartoum, resulting in 23 fatalities and over 40 injuries. The attack on Saturday afternoon is part of ongoing civil conflict that has claimed thousands of lives.

title: Iran condemns 'illegal and unjustified' US sanctions on oil industry: ministry
content: Iran denounces US sanctions on its oil industry as 'illegal and unjustified' following Tehran's missile attack on Israel. The US targets firms and vessels involved in selling Iranian oil, while Iran insists on its right to respond and condemns the sanctions as threats to regional peace. The new wave of sanctions comes as the world awaits Israel's promised response to Tehran's missile attack, with oil prices hitting their highest levels since August.
summary: Iran denounces US sanctions on its oil industry as 'illegal and unjustified' following Tehran's missile attack on Israel. The US targets firms and vessels involved in selling Iranian oil, while Iran insists on its right to respond and condemns the sanctions as threats to regional peace. The new wave of sanctions comes as the world awaits Israel's promised response to Tehran's missile attack, with oil prices hitting their highest levels since August.

title: 'Still suffering, unable to work': Woman knocked out after cauliflower falls on her head
content: In the UK, Sammi Mai, 42, was hospitalized after a cauliflower fell on her head, causing her to lose consciousness. She continues to suffer from symptoms affecting her work life. She criticized the store for poor safety measures and is considering legal action. The store claims to have handled the incident promptly.
summary: In the UK, Sammi Mai, 42, was hospitalized after a cauliflower fell on her head, causing her to lose consciousness. She continues to suffer from symptoms affecting her work life. She criticized the store for poor safety measures and is considering legal action. The store claims to have handled the incident promptly.

title: New Sri Lankan government orders reinvestigation of several high-profile cases
content: Sri Lanka’s new government has directed the police to reinvestigate unresolved high-profile cases, including the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks, a 2005 Tamil journalist's murder, and other significant crimes. The Ministry of Public Security aims to identify investigative lapses and address alleged cover-ups by previous administrations.
summary: Sri Lanka’s new government has directed the police to reinvestigate unresolved high-profile cases, including the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks, a 2005 Tamil journalist's murder, and other significant crimes. The Ministry of Public Security aims to identify investigative lapses and address alleged cover-ups by previous administrations.

title: Israel-Hezbollah clash: Another UN peacekeeper injured amid escalating conflict
content: Hezbollah engaged Israeli forces in southern Lebanon as Israeli strikes hit UNIFIL bases, injuring peacekeepers. U.N. Secretary-General and Western countries condemned the attacks. Israeli assaults on Gaza killed 29 Palestinians amid ongoing military operations. Evacuations were ordered in northern Israel and southern Lebanon as conflict escalated with significant civilian displacement and casualties.
summary: Hezbollah engaged Israeli forces in southern Lebanon as Israeli strikes hit UNIFIL bases, injuring peacekeepers. U.N. Secretary-General and Western countries condemned the attacks. Israeli assaults on Gaza killed 29 Palestinians amid ongoing military operations. Evacuations were ordered in northern Israel and southern Lebanon as conflict escalated with significant civilian displacement and casualties.

title: Macao's former top judge elected as Chinese casino hub's first leader born in mainland China
content: Sam Hou Fai, a former top judge, has been elected as Macao's new leader in a largely ceremonial vote. He is set to become the city's first chief executive born in mainland China, marking a shift from business-driven governance to a legal professional prioritized by Beijing.
summary: Sam Hou Fai, a former top judge, has been elected as Macao's new leader in a largely ceremonial vote. He is set to become the city's first chief executive born in mainland China, marking a shift from business-driven governance to a legal professional prioritized by Beijing.

title: 'Path to self destruction': Nobel Peace prize winners, atomic bomb survivors, warn of nuclear threat
content: Leaders of Nihon Hidankyo warn of an increasing nuclear war threat and call for complete nuclear disarmament. Shigemitsu Tanaka, bomb survivor, emphasizes the deteriorating global situation amid tensions. Their plea follows receiving the Nobel Peace Prize, recognizing their anti-nuclear efforts, and is highlighted by recent statements from Russian President Vladimir Putin on nuclear options.
summary: Leaders of Nihon Hidankyo warn of an increasing nuclear war threat and call for complete nuclear disarmament. Shigemitsu Tanaka, bomb survivor, emphasizes the deteriorating global situation amid tensions. Their plea follows receiving the Nobel Peace Prize, recognizing their anti-nuclear efforts, and is highlighted by recent statements from Russian President Vladimir Putin on nuclear options.

title: Pakistan prepares for SCO Summit amidst security concerns
content: Ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit, Pakistan gears up to secure Islamabad amid recent militant attacks and political unrest. Authorities enforce strict measures, including troop deployment and a ban on protests. Key attendees include officials from China, India, and Russia. The summit will focus on trade, humanitarian, and cultural issues, despite Pakistan's escalating domestic tensions.
summary: Ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit, Pakistan gears up to secure Islamabad amid recent militant attacks and political unrest. Authorities enforce strict measures, including troop deployment and a ban on protests. Key attendees include officials from China, India, and Russia. The summit will focus on trade, humanitarian, and cultural issues, despite Pakistan's escalating domestic tensions.

title: 'Do they want ZERO Catholic votes for Harris?': Christian officials slam governor's viral video mocking holy communion
content: Michigan’s Catholic leaders, including all seven diocesan bishops, criticized Governor Gretchen Whitmer for a video where she mimics administering Communion with a Dorito. They view the video as mocking the Christian sacrament and call for respect toward religious practices.
summary: Michigan’s Catholic leaders, including all seven diocesan bishops, criticized Governor Gretchen Whitmer for a video where she mimics administering Communion with a Dorito. They view the video as mocking the Christian sacrament and call for respect toward religious practices.

title: 3 nurses struck by jeep in hit-and-run while assisting gunshot victim in Philadelphia hospital
content: A vehicle fleeing from Penn Presbyterian Medical Center in Philadelphia struck three nurses, critically injuring one, after dropping off a gunshot victim. The 28-year-old victim suffered multiple gunshot wounds and a possible head injury. Hospital staff continued patient care despite the incident. Philadelphia police are investigating the hit-and-run and earlier shooting.
summary: A vehicle fleeing from Penn Presbyterian Medical Center in Philadelphia struck three nurses, critically injuring one, after dropping off a gunshot victim. The 28-year-old victim suffered multiple gunshot wounds and a possible head injury. Hospital staff continued patient care despite the incident. Philadelphia police are investigating the hit-and-run and earlier shooting.

title: US soldier sentenced to 14 years for aiding ISIS and conspiring to murder American troops
content: Cole Bridges, a US army soldier, has been sentenced to 14 years for attempting to help ISIS plan attacks on American troops. Bridges provided training and guidance to purported ISIS fighters, shared Army manuals, and advised on ambushing US forces. His actions included recording supportive videos and sending attack instructions.
summary: Cole Bridges, a US army soldier, has been sentenced to 14 years for attempting to help ISIS plan attacks on American troops. Bridges provided training and guidance to purported ISIS fighters, shared Army manuals, and advised on ambushing US forces. His actions included recording supportive videos and sending attack instructions.

title: Woman pleads guilty to smuggling 29 turtles worth $40K across US-Canada border
content: Wan Yee Ng admitted to trying to smuggle 29 eastern box turtles, valued over $40,000, from the US to Canada via an inflatable kayak. She faces sentencing in December after being caught in Vermont. The turtles were likely intended for sale in Hong Kong. Ng has agreed to pay for their care.
summary: Wan Yee Ng admitted to trying to smuggle 29 eastern box turtles, valued over $40,000, from the US to Canada via an inflatable kayak. She faces sentencing in December after being caught in Vermont. The turtles were likely intended for sale in Hong Kong. Ng has agreed to pay for their care.

title: Baloch human rights activist charged with terrorism
content: Pakistani police filed a case against human rights activist Dr Mahrang Baloch, accusing her of aiding separatist groups in Balochistan. She was recently barred from a flight to New York. Baloch denies the allegations, claiming the state targets her due to her activism against enforced disappearances and extra-judicial killings.
summary: Pakistani police filed a case against human rights activist Dr Mahrang Baloch, accusing her of aiding separatist groups in Balochistan. She was recently barred from a flight to New York. Baloch denies the allegations, claiming the state targets her due to her activism against enforced disappearances and extra-judicial killings.

title: 'We’re getting Diddy freaky tonight': Landon Barker slammed for baby oil theme at birthday party
content: Landon Barker is facing criticism for attending a party that mocked sexual assault accusations against Sean “Diddy” Combs. Videos from the event showed baby oil references and insensitive jokes, sparking outrage online. Diddy is under investigation for alleged abuse at his 'Freak Off' parties.
summary: Landon Barker is facing criticism for attending a party that mocked sexual assault accusations against Sean “Diddy” Combs. Videos from the event showed baby oil references and insensitive jokes, sparking outrage online. Diddy is under investigation for alleged abuse at his 'Freak Off' parties.

title: Watch: College student discovers live scorpion in parcel
content: A University of Bristol student discovered a live scorpion in a package of boots from Shein. With the help of her flatmates, she captured the insect and contacted the National Centre for Reptile Welfare. Shein conducted an internal investigation, confirming their standard procedures were followed.
summary: A University of Bristol student discovered a live scorpion in a package of boots from Shein. With the help of her flatmates, she captured the insect and contacted the National Centre for Reptile Welfare. Shein conducted an internal investigation, confirming their standard procedures were followed.

title: Hurricane Milton triggers EF-3 Tornado in Florida's Palm Beach County, leaving seven injured
content: Hurricane Milton spawned a powerful tornado in Florida's Palm Beach County, injuring seven and causing widespread damage. The tornado, which struck on Wednesday, had peak winds of 140 mph, destroyed homes, uprooted trees, and caused significant structural damage, classified as an EF-3 by the NWS.
summary: Hurricane Milton spawned a powerful tornado in Florida's Palm Beach County, injuring seven and causing widespread damage. The tornado, which struck on Wednesday, had peak winds of 140 mph, destroyed homes, uprooted trees, and caused significant structural damage, classified as an EF-3 by the NWS.
